trans-unit.source: This class provides writable access to certain attributes so that users can modify read-only properties of the "dummy" principal object that is passed to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearcher"></xref> object when using [Query By Example](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/84ac40bb-04c4-4d0b-adaf-0ddb9253599e).

The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AdvancedFilters> class is accessed from a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal> object through the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal.AdvancedSearchFilter%2A> property, and is effectually treated like a property of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal> object, and isn't intended to be used on its own.
Instantiates a new <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AdvancedFilters"></xref> object.
Not intended to be called directly.

Applications should access <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AdvancedFilters> through the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.UserPrincipal.AdvancedSearchFilter%2A> property of the user object.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal"></xref> object.
Sets the query filter for the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal.AccountExpirationDate"></xref> attribute to the specified time and comparison type.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of your <xref:System.DateTime> object as <xref:System.DateTimeKind?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object.
A that specifies how expirationTime should be used in the comparison.
Sets the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal.AccountLockoutTime"></xref> query filter to the specified time and comparison type.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of your <xref:System.DateTime> object as <xref:System.DateTimeKind?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object.
A that specifies how lockoutTime should be used in the comparison.
Creates a query filter for a property in an extended class.
The name of the attribute
An object.
The object type of value.
A that specifies how value should be compared to the attribute's value.
Sets the query filter for the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal.BadLogonCount"></xref> attribute to the specified value and comparison type.
An integer.
A that specifies how badLogonCount should be compared to the attribute's value.

Sets the query filter for the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal.LastBadPasswordAttempt"></xref> attribute to the specified <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> and the specified comparison value.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of your <xref:System.DateTime> object as <xref:System.DateTimeKind?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object.
A that specifies how lastAttempt should be used in the comparison.

Sets the query filter for the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal.LastLogon"></xref> attribute to the specified <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> and the specified comparison value.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of your <xref:System.DateTime> object as <xref:System.DateTimeKind?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object.
A that specifies how logonTime should be used in the comparison.

Sets the query filter for the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal.LastPasswordSet"></xref> attribute to the specified <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> and the specified comparison value.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of your <xref:System.DateTime> object as <xref:System.DateTimeKind?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> object.
A that specifies how passwordSetTime should be used in the comparison.
